	Salary: N100,000 - N200,000 monthly.

  "description": "Jake Riley&nbsp;Limited is a leading international consultancy that helps leading companies, public sector bodies and social sector organisations in Nigeria to build, improve their performance and tackle the challenges they face. We have the unique ability to connect clients with their target audience and create direct access to qualified prospects. Our team of experts have a wide range and depth of experience in key business issues and can advise our clients on their key strategic issues as well as help solve their toughest and most critical business problems.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Technical Safety Lead Engineer

Job Location:&nbsp;Port Harcourt, Rivers
Job type: Full-time

Job Description


	Job dimensions Managerial: Direct reports: 2 (Engineer and Designer) Functional reports: To be determined Total staff: 2+


Accountabilities&nbsp;


	Risk Assessment: Work with critical contacts to maintain technological and operational risk assessment compliance studies using approved DGEP guidelines and methodology for all operating sites.&nbsp;
	Safety Engineering: Facilitate safety studies and review to assist management of change requests. Perform effective safety engineering design studies&nbsp;
	Follow up with all Safety Engineering design requirements through the Project construction.&nbsp;
	Ensure compliance to applicable local / international regulations and Company Standards for Safety Engineering&nbsp;
	Make input on Safety Engineering documents for Project asset design, operations and abandonment, in conformity with Group, Industry and Statutory requirements. In particlular, identification of Safety Critical Elements (SCEs), development and validation of Safety Concept and Safety Dossier,&nbsp;
	Follow up contractor&rsquo;s activities and deliverables to ensure compliance with project specification.&nbsp;


Risk Assessment:


	Lead specific Safety Engineering studies / reviews in support of Request for Modification (RFM) process and Downgraded Situations (DGS) &ndash; HAZOP, HAZID, BowTie Assessment etc.&nbsp;
	Support Project departments in Derogation preparation.&nbsp;
	Undertake flammable/toxic gas dispersion, fire and explosion consequence modelling using PHAST software, and inteprete result for safe operation of the Project.&nbsp;
	Review and make necessary inputs to all safety-related modifications and corresponding engineering documents of the Project (P&amp;ID, ESD Logic, Fire and Gas Cause and effects charts, Active and passive firefighting, fire and gas detection, escape and evacuation route, Hazardous area classification, Safety layout, flare radiation).&nbsp;
	Assist in the update of Operational Safety Case in line with regulatory (NUPRC) requirement for operates sites in Nigeria.&nbsp;


Major Risk Management:


	Support major risk identification and development of risk reduction measures for technological risks management in line with GS GR HSE 312: Technological Risk Assessment (TRA) requirement.&nbsp;
	Facilitate Safety and Environmental Critical Element (SECE) identification workshops and the follow up of Safety Engineering responsibilities as specified in CR GR HSE 403 / GS GR HSE 311&nbsp;
	Support Major Risk management implementation through development of dashboards / solutions for monitoring barrier status.
	Lead Major Risk awareness training and barrier verification exercises.&nbsp;
	Contribute to Learning from Events&nbsp;
	Participate to incident investigation and Cause Tree Analysis linked to Process Safety Events, proposing recommendations to prevent recurrence. Prepare and make presentations to management on incident investigation reports&nbsp;


Context and environment:


	The Technical Safety Lead Engineer who is expected to demonstrate a very high level of expertise and experience in both process safety and operational HSE, shall lead the technical management and assurance of Process Safety engineering of one or more projects executed in a multi-disciplinary environment under the Project Portfolio Management Division of TotalEnergies EP Nigeria Limited.&nbsp;


HSE Objectives:


	Familiarize self with TEPNG emergency procedures, carry out assigned responsibilities safely and report any incident, unsafe act, or operation&nbsp;
	To report and participate actively in anomaly reporting&nbsp;
	To ensure 100% compliance of PPE and PTW within the work area.


Qualifications/Experience


	Minimum of Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree or equivalent in Chemical, Petroleum or related Engineering (an M.Sc. degree in Safety Engineering is a plus).&nbsp;
	Typically, 10 years of oil and gas industry professional experience of which at least 2 years in an equivalent position as Safety &amp; Loss Prevention Engineer.&nbsp;
	Good knowledge of Loss Prevention standards and procedure and major hazard legislation.&nbsp;
	Good knowledge of risk assessment techniques and management (HAZOP, HAZID, HAZAN, QRA) and other reviews.&nbsp;
	Autonomous with investigation/observation skills, effective communication and organizational capability .


Method of Application&nbsp;

Technical Safety Lead Engineer Job at Jake Riley Limited




        
    

        
        Jake Riley Limited is a leading international consultancy that helps leading companies, public sector bodies and social sector organisations in Nigeria to build, improve their performance and tackle the challenges they face. We have the unique ability to connect clients with their target audience and create direct access to qualified prospects. Our team of experts have a wide range and depth of experience in key business issues and can advise our clients on their key strategic issues as well as help solve their toughest and most critical business problems.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Technical Safety Lead Engineer
     

            
    



Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Job type: Full-time

Job Description


	Job dimensions Managerial: Direct reports: 2 (Engineer and Designer) Functional reports: To be determined Total staff: 2+


Accountabilities 


	Risk Assessment: Work with critical contacts to maintain technological and operational risk assessment compliance studies using approved DGEP guidelines and methodology for all operating sites. 
	Safety Engineering: Facilitate safety studies and review to assist management of change requests. Perform effective safety engineering design studies 
	Follow up with all Safety Engineering design requirements through the Project construction. 
	Ensure compliance to applicable local / international regulations and Company Standards for Safety Engineering 
	Make input on Safety Engineering documents for Project asset design, operations and abandonment, in conformity with Group, Industry and Statutory requirements. In particlular, identification of Safety Critical Elements (SCEs), development and validation of Safety Concept and Safety Dossier, 
	Follow up contractor’s activities and deliverables to ensure compliance with project specification. 


Risk Assessment:


	Lead specific Safety Engineering studies / reviews in support of Request for Modification (RFM) process and Downgraded Situations (DGS) – HAZOP, HAZID, BowTie Assessment etc. 
	Support Project departments in Derogation preparation. 
	Undertake flammable/toxic gas dispersion, fire and explosion consequence modelling using PHAST software, and inteprete result for safe operation of the Project. 
	Review and make necessary inputs to all safety-related modifications and corresponding engineering documents of the Project (P&ID, ESD Logic, Fire and Gas Cause and effects charts, Active and passive firefighting, fire and gas detection, escape and evacuation route, Hazardous area classification, Safety layout, flare radiation). 
	Assist in the update of Operational Safety Case in line with regulatory (NUPRC) requirement for operates sites in Nigeria. 


Major Risk Management:


	Support major risk identification and development of risk reduction measures for technological risks management in line with GS GR HSE 312: Technological Risk Assessment (TRA) requirement. 
	Facilitate Safety and Environmental Critical Element (SECE) identification workshops and the follow up of Safety Engineering responsibilities as specified in CR GR HSE 403 / GS GR HSE 311 
	Support Major Risk management implementation through development of dashboards / solutions for monitoring barrier status.
	Lead Major Risk awareness training and barrier verification exercises. 
	Contribute to Learning from Events 
	Participate to incident investigation and Cause Tree Analysis linked to Process Safety Events, proposing recommendations to prevent recurrence. Prepare and make presentations to management on incident investigation reports 


Context and environment:


	The Technical Safety Lead Engineer who is expected to demonstrate a very high level of expertise and experience in both process safety and operational HSE, shall lead the technical management and assurance of Process Safety engineering of one or more projects executed in a multi-disciplinary environment under the Project Portfolio Management Division of TotalEnergies EP Nigeria Limited. 


HSE Objectives:


	Familiarize self with TEPNG emergency procedures, carry out assigned responsibilities safely and report any incident, unsafe act, or operation 
	To report and participate actively in anomaly reporting 
	To ensure 100% compliance of PPE and PTW within the work area.


Qualifications/Experience


	Minimum of Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in Chemical, Petroleum or related Engineering (an M.Sc. degree in Safety Engineering is a plus). 
	Typically, 10 years of oil and gas industry professional experience of which at least 2 years in an equivalent position as Safety & Loss Prevention Engineer. 
	Good knowledge of Loss Prevention standards and procedure and major hazard legislation. 
	Good knowledge of risk assessment techniques and management (HAZOP, HAZID, HAZAN, QRA) and other reviews. 
	Autonomous with investigation/observation skills, effective communication and organizational capability .


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: recruitment@jakeriley.org using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
